item.title: Kim Halliday
item.description:
Kim Halliday

Kim Halliday, Composer: Credo. Kim is a composer and musician working in London, UK. He began playing the violin at age 7, took up the guitar and dropped the violin (although he kept the bow) at 13, and spent his early teens trying to become Jimmy Page.

item.title: Commissioning Music for Short Films - 10 Questions a Director Might Ask | Filmmaker Magazine
item.description:
Commissioning Music for Short Films - 10 Questions a Director Might Ask | Filmmaker Magazine

Back to selection The following is a guest post written by composer Kim Halliday, a U.K.-based composer who has written music for shorts, features, documentary and fiction. You can find his work at www.kimhalliday.com, under "Kim Halliday - Music" on Facebook, and @hallidayk on Twitter.

Official website for London based production company Two Bells Productions.

item.title: INTERVIEW: Kim Halliday -
item.description:
INTERVIEW: Kim Halliday -

Hi Kim, welcome to VENTS! How have you been? Hey Vents, my life is good, thanks. I'm very happy with the way in which people have been reacting to my new tunes, although it's sort of sad that my friend Martin Lister, who produced and played on the album, isn't here to see it.

item.title: Morpheus Music Interviews - Kim Halliday
item.description:
Morpheus Music Interviews - Kim Halliday

19.06.13 - on release of Birdsong In Mist My memories of being very small seem to be accompanied by a soundtrack provided by the Beatles - I remember seeing the Our World broadcast of All You Need Is Love, for example, when I was 6 years old.

item.title: Looking for Vi (2014)
item.description:
Looking for Vi (2014)

Our story opens with Julia (Laura Glover) on her way to collect the very last autograph she needs; that of actress Evelyn Hawthorn (Josie Lawrence), only then will she be able to rest easy having collected the autographs of every actor to appear in the popular soap opera Jubilee Road.

item.title: Silver
item.description:
Silver

Video for Rat Scabies "Oboe" remix of Silver from Kim Halliday's forthcoming album "Birdsong In Mist"
